title: Australia Cocaine Busts Hit Record as Gangs Traffic $7.3 Billion in Illicit Drugs
description: Cocaine seizures more than doubled in Australia amid a global surge in trafficking and as international crime syndicates found new ways to bring illicit drugs and precursor chemicals into the country, agencies said.

title: Congo Electoral Body Defends Delays, Begins Release of Results
description: Democratic Republic of Congo’s electoral commission, CENI, defended the major delays snarling the country’s Dec. 20 polls as the commission began Friday to release a small sampling of results.

title: Good Economic News May Be Breaking Through as Voters Take Notice
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Friday, White House correspondent Akayla Gardner delivers a roundup of the key news and events in politics, policy and economics that you need to know. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.

title: Rising Consumer Sentiment Gives White House Confidence Ahead of 2024
description: Rising consumer sentiment is fueling hopes inside the White House that Americans will warm to President Joe Biden’s economic leadership, as inflation slowed to a milestone level.

title: US Approves $1 Billion in New Military Training for Saudi Arabia
description: The US State Department approved $1 billion in military training for Saudi Arabia, renewing a program that’s deepened ties between the two partners while still sticking to a ban on the sale of some offensive weapons.

title: US Says Red Sea ‘Highway Patrol’ Able to Thwart Houthi Attacks
description: The US’s new international naval coalition will serve as a “highway patrol” to protect shipping in the Red Sea from attacks by Iran-backed Houthi militants even though it won’t escort individual vessels, a Pentagon spokesman said.

title: DeSantis Support Shifts to New Super PACs Amid Campaign Tumult
description: Two new super PACs allied with Florida Governor Ron DeSantis booked more than $8 million in advertisements in recent weeks to boost his presidential bid, as Never Back Down, the group that has been supporting his campaign for months, pulls back ad spending amid internal turmoil.

title: Supreme Court Refuses to Put Trump Immunity Clash on Fast Track
description: The US Supreme Court refused to decide immediately whether former President Donald Trump is immune from prosecution for seeking to overturn his 2020 election loss, in a blow to prosecutors’ efforts to start trial on March 4.

title: Trump Says He’s No ‘Student’ of Hitler, Defends Anti-Immigrant Remark
description: Former president Donald Trump said he is not a “student” of Adolf Hitler and defended his comments about undocumented immigrants that critics have compared to the Nazi leader’s comments about Jewish people.

title: Turkey Puts Sweden’s NATO Bid Back on Agenda Next Week
description: A Turkish parliamentary committee will resume discussions on Sweden’s NATO membership application next week, putting ratification back on the agenda in a country that’s been a key holdout.

title: UN Security Council Passes Resolution on Increasing Gaza Aid
description: The United Nations Security Council passed a resolution Friday that called for increasing the flow of aid into the Gaza Strip but stopped short of demanding a cease-fire between Israel and Hamas.

title: Congo to Name Next President by End of Year, Commission Says
description: Democratic Republic of Congo’s electoral commission will begin broadcasting results of the country’s Dec. 20 poll on Friday with the intention of announcing the next president by the end of the year.

title: Indonesia’s Baswedan to Tax The Rich, Prabowo Touts Revenue Reform in Debate
description: Indonesia’s vice-presidential candidates laid out their economic policies in a debate, including pledges to raise taxes for the wealthy and set up a standalone revenue agency.

title: Brazil’s Farmers Plan 2024 Congress Offensive in Challenge to Lula
description: Brazil’s agriculture sector is planning a 2024 legislative offensive that is poised to challenge President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva’s ambitious environmental agenda and test his already-wobbly relationship with the country’s conservative Congress.

title: Biden Pardons Many Federal Marijuana Charges, Commutes Others
description: President Joe Biden issued a sweeping pardon to Americans convicted of using or possessing marijuana on certain federal lands and commuted the sentences of nearly a dozen non-violent drug offenders, echoing a move he made last year that highlighted his justice reform agenda.

title: Past, Present & Future: UK Politics in 2023 and Beyond
description: Get caught up on the day’s political news

title: Drugmakers Delay In-Demand Medicines to Evade Biden’s New Pricing Rules
description: Drugmakers are slow-walking products to market to get around President Joe Biden’s plan to lower medication prices.

title: Senators Give Early Approval to Meloni’s Budget Balancing Act
description: Italy’s Senate gave early approval to the new budget law, the product of a tough balancing act by Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni between fiscal sustainability and keeping promises to voters.

title: Prague Gunman Killed Himself After Deadliest Czech Shooting
description: Czech police said the attacker who went on a rampage at Prague’s Charles University on Thursday turned the gun on himself after killing 14 in the deadliest shooting in the country’s history.

title: New Fires Threaten a World Already in Flames
description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.

title: Trump’s Swing-State Strategy Targets Black Voters Unhappy With Biden
description: Donald Trump’s lead in 2024 election polls has him eyeing a long-shot gambit: attracting a larger share of Black voters than any Republican presidential candidate in modern history.

title: US Aims Tougher Sanctions at Banks in Latest Bid to Hurt Putin
description: The US announced new plans to target banks that facilitate payments for Russia’s military-industrial complex, the latest in a series of restrictions that have tried — and so far failed — to cripple President Vladimir Putin’s ability to fund his invasion of Ukraine.

title: Khan Granted Bail by Pakistan’s Top Court in Cable Leak Case
description: Pakistan’s Supreme Court on Friday granted bail to former Prime Minister Imran Khan in a case related to violating the country’s secrecy laws by making a diplomatic cable public while in office.

title: Macron to Visit India in Jan. as Modi’s Guest for Republic Day
description: French President Emmanuel Macron accepted an invitation to attend India’s Republic Day celebrations as a chief guest of Prime Minister Narendra Modi, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Polish Finance Minister Softens Tone in Central Banker Standoff
description: Polish Finance Minister Andrzej Domanski sought to lower the temperature in a standoff between the new ruling coalition and central bank chief, saying financial markets didn’t want a row between the country’s fiscal and monetary policymakers.

title: Japan to Sell Missiles to US in Easing of Arms Export Rules
description: Japan loosened its restrictions on arms exports on Friday and officially approved a plan to export Patriot missiles to the US, fulfilling a request from its ally, the government said.

title: Guinea-Bissau’s Embalo Names New Cabinet Amid Political Turmoil
description: President Umaro Sissoco Embalo named a new cabinet for Guinea-Bissau, days after dismissing his prime minister twice following a foiled coup.

title: Russia Seizes Top Car Dealership Owned by Putin Critic’s Family
description: Russia will seize control of one of the country’s biggest car dealerships owned by the family of a wealthy Kremlin critic who is now living in exile.

title: Russian Women Are Starting to Demand Putin Bring Their Men Home From War in Ukraine
description: More than a year after President Vladimir Putin summoned 300,000 draftees to fight in Russia’s war in Ukraine, some of their families are starting to demand that they come home.

title: China’s Top Court to Launch Public Database of Example Rulings
description: China’s highest court said it is launching a database with a small selection of legal cases — a move that comes amid concern a decade-old public repository of tens of millions of cases may be closed, limiting transparency.

title: CIA’s Chief Spy Emerges as Key Figure in Hamas Hostage Crisis
description: Central Intelligence Agency Director William Burns has emerged as the main player in US efforts to secure the release of hostages held by Hamas, tapping decades of contacts and leveraging his ability to move through the region quietly to tackle one of the US’s gravest foreign-policy crises.

title: HK Court Rejects Jimmy Lai’s Bid to Dismiss Sedition Charge
description: A Hong Kong court rejected Jimmy Lai’s request to throw out a sedition charge on Friday, handing the democracy activist an early defeat in a trial closely scrutinized by Western governments.

title: US Signals Support for UN Resolution Seeking to Bolster Gaza Aid
description: The US signaled it could support a resolution through the United Nations Security Council that would increase aid flowing to Gaza after drawn out negotiations that threatened to defeat the measure.

title: Indonesia’s Panjaitan Returns to Ministry After Medical Leave
description: Luhut Panjaitan, who led talks for Tesla Inc. investment and Indonesia’s $20 billion climate financing deal, has resumed his role as senior minister after nearly three months of medical leave.
